result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Stephen Schley

defendant.name: Schley, Michael Stephen
defendant.address: 4950 North Larkin Street, Whitefish Bay, WI 53217

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Michael Stephen Schley in court with attorney Raymond Michael Dall'Osto.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered case dismissed and read-in.

Defendant Michael Stephen Schley in court with attorney Roberto Dall'Asta for Steven Mcgaver.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Attorney Mcgaver is out with an ill child.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Parties are advised that effective December 14, 2015, this case will be assigned to the Reserve Judge presiding in Branch 21 in room 622 of the Courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Michael Stephen Schley in court with attorney Steven C. Mcgaver.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael Stephen Schley in court with attorney Steven C. Mcgaver.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 24.  Status conference scheduled for November 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael Stephen Schley in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with any Walmart.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Michael Stephen Schley in court.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 24  for a Pretrial Conference.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 7/17/15 @ 1:30 pm
